persons.name: Mestre Vicente Pastinha
persons.description: Iconic figure of Capoeira Angola. Preserved its traditions through CECA in Salvador.

persons.name: Mestre João Pequeno
persons.description: Student of Mestre Pastinha and co-leader of CECA. Later founded his own school to carry on the lineage and taught several notable mestres including Jogo de Dentro and Barba Branca.

persons.name: Mestre João Grande
persons.description: One of the foremost students of Mestre Pastinha. He moved to New York and established an academy there, spreading Capoeira Angola internationally.

persons.name: Mestre Jogo de Dentro
persons.description: Student of João Pequeno. Founded Grupo Semente do Jogo de Angola in Salvador. Known for preserving the Angola style in its traditional form.

persons.name: Mestre Pedro Moraes (Mestre Moraes)
persons.description: Founder of GCAP. A student of João Grande and João Pequeno. One of the key figures in the revival of Capoeira Angola.

persons.name: Mestre Cobra Mansa
persons.description: Student of Mestre Moraes. Co-founder of FICA. Known for internationalizing Capoeira Angola and tracing its roots to Africa.

persons.name: Mestre Manuel dos Reis Machado (Mestre Bimba)
persons.description: Founder of Capoeira Regional. First to create a formal school and introduce a structured pedagogy.

persons.name: Mestre Manoel Nascimento Machado (Mestre Nenel)
studentOf: Mestre Manuel dos Reis Machado (Mestre Bimba)
persons.description: Son of Mestre Bimba. Founded Filhos de Bimba to preserve his father's legacy.

persons.name: Mestre Ubirajara Almeida (Mestre Acordeon)
studentOf: Mestre Manuel dos Reis Machado (Mestre Bimba)

persons.name: Mestre Reinaldo Ramos Suassuna
persons.description: Co-founder of Cordão de Ouro. Known for musical innovation and wide international influence.

persons.name: Mestre Djamir Pinatti
studentOf: Mestre Manuel dos Reis Machado (Mestre Bimba)

persons.name: Mestre Corisco (José Olimpio)
persons.description: Student of Mestre Andrade. Founded Chapéu de Couro, active in Recife and Europe.

persons.name: Mestre Doutor (Adenilson dos Santos)
persons.description: Student of Mestre Bandeira. Founded Project Capoeira in Philadelphia.

persons.name: Mestre Roberto Teles (Mestre Sombra)
persons.description: Student of Mestre Bispo. Founded Capoeira Senzala de Santos and taught many future mestres.

persons.name: Mestre Laudelino Ramos de Lima (Mestre Lima)
persons.description: Student of Mestre Sombra. Founded Filhos de Senzala and Arte Popular.

persons.name: Mestre António Carlos de Lima (Mestre Liminha)
studentOf: Mestre Laudelino Ramos de Lima (Mestre Lima)
persons.description: Student of Mestre Lima. Helped expand capoeira in Brazil and Europe.

persons.name: Mestre Beck
studentOf: Mestre Laudelino Ramos de Lima (Mestre Lima)
persons.description: Student of Mestre Lima. Part of the Filhos de Senzala lineage.

persons.name: Mestre Demerval Lacerda (Mestre Leopoldina)
persons.description: Known for his malícia and charisma. Learned from Quinzinho and Artur Emídio.

persons.name: Mestre Nestor Capoeira (Nestor dos Passos)
persons.description: Student of Mestre Leopoldina. Popularized capoeira worldwide through books and teachings.

persons.name: Mestre Jelon Vieira
persons.description: Founded Capoeira Luanda. Introduced capoeira in New York in the 1970s.

persons.name: Mestre Eziquiel
studentOf: Mestre Manuel dos Reis Machado (Mestre Bimba)

persons.name: Mestre Marcos da Silva (Mestre Barrão)
persons.description: Founder of Axé Capoeira. Pioneer of capoeira in North America.

persons.name: Mestre Pirajá
studentOf: Mestre Manuel dos Reis Machado (Mestre Bimba)

persons.name: Mestre José Tadeu Cardoso (Mestre Camisa)
studentOf: Mestre Manuel dos Reis Machado (Mestre Bimba)
persons.description: Founder of ABADÁ. Student of Mestre Bimba. Known for systematizing capoeira training.

persons.name: Mestre Luiz Simas (Mestre Boneco)
persons.description: One of the founders of Grupo Capoeira Brasil. Previously part of Senzala.

persons.name: Mestre Paulo S. da Silva (Mestre Paulão Muzenza)
persons.description: Founder of Muzenza. Known for promoting capoeira through formal events and publications.

persons.name: Mestre Paulo A. S. (Mestre Paulinho Sabiá)
Mestre Itapoan
studentOf: Mestre Manuel dos Reis Machado (Mestre Bimba)

persons.name: Mestre Itamar Acidino (Mestre Burguês)
studentOf: Mestre Paulo S. da Silva (Mestre Paulão Muzenza)

persons.name: Contra Mestre Cabeção
persons.description: Founder and lead teacher of Cai Na Capoeira. Began training with Mestre Esquilo in Sete Lagoas, Brazil in 1996. Has over 25 years of experience teaching and performing in Brazil, Israel, and the U.S.

persons.name: Instrutora Areia
persons.description: Assistant instructor at Cai Na Capoeira. Began training in 2007 with Capoeira Mandinga Com Expressão in Rochester, NY. Continued training under Professora Casca Dura (Cordão de Ouro) and joined Cai Na Capoeira in 2011.

persons.name: Mestre Esquilo
persons.description: Cordão de Ouro representative in Sete Lagoas, Brazil. Teacher of Contra Mestre Cabeção and a known figure within the CDO lineage.

persons.name: Professora Casca Dura
persons.description: Capoeira Cordão de Ouro teacher in Rochester, NY. Early instructor of Instrutora Areia.

groups.name: Academia de Capoeira Regional (Mestre Bimba's School)
groups.foundedBy: Mestre Manuel dos Reis Machado (Mestre Bimba)
groups.description: Founded by Mestre Bimba. First legal capoeira school. Taught Capoeira Regional in a structured form.

groups.name: Centro Esportivo de Capoeira Angola (CECA)
groups.description: Founded by Mestre Pastinha to preserve Capoeira Angola. Known for teaching foundational Angola mestres.

groups.name: Grupo Senzala
groups.description: Founded in the 1960s in Rio. Helped popularize capoeira internationally. Known for its blended Angola/Regional approach.

groups.name: Associação de Capoeira Cordão de Ouro
groups.description: Founded by Mestre Suassuna and Mestre Brasília. Known for technical skill and global reach.

groups.name: ABADÁ-Capoeira
groups.description: Founded by Mestre Camisa. A structured, pedagogical capoeira organization with wide international presence.

groups.name: Grupo Capoeira Brasil
groups.description: Founded by Mestres Boneco, Paulão, and Paulinho Sabiá. Known for its innovative and contemporary style.

groups.name: Grupo Muzenza de Capoeira
groups.foundedBy: Mestre Paulo S. da Silva (Mestre Paulão Muzenza)
groups.description: Founded by Mestre Paulão Muzenza. Hosts major capoeira events and promotes its values globally.

groups.name: Grupo Axé Capoeira
groups.description: Founded by Mestre Barrão in Canada. One of the most widespread international capoeira groups.

groups.name: Fundação Mestre Bimba (Filhos de Bimba School)
groups.description: Founded by Mestre Nenel to continue Mestre Bimba’s original Capoeira Regional.

groups.name: Grupo de Capoeira Semente do Jogo de Angola
groups.description: Founded by Mestre Jogo de Dentro. Focused on traditional Angola style.

groups.name: Grupo Capoeira Angola Pelourinho (GCAP)
groups.description: Founded by Mestre Moraes. A key group in the international revival of Capoeira Angola.

groups.name: International Capoeira Angola Foundation (FICA)
groups.description: Founded by Mestre Cobra Mansa. Major promoter of Capoeira Angola with international reach.

groups.name: Grupo de Capoeira Chapéu de Couro
groups.description: Founded by Mestre Corisco in Recife. Known for its longevity and reach in Brazil and Europe.

groups.name: Capoeira Luanda
groups.description: Founded by Mestre Jelon Vieira. One of the earliest capoeira groups in the USA.

groups.name: Cai Na Capoeira
groups.academia: Associação de Capoeira Cordão de Ouro
groups.description: Capoeira group based in Westchester County, NY, founded in January 2012 by Contra Mestre Cabeção. Offers classes and events across Ossining, Tarrytown, Peekskill, White Plains, Beacon, and Cold Spring. Connected to the Cordão de Ouro lineage through Mestre Esquilo.
